messages.subject: Tia's sig line
messages.msgSnippet: I found the quote so wonderful I used in a conversation also. I was talking with some ladies at church that homeSCHOOL and I put that emphasis there for
messages.messageBody:
I found the quote so wonderful I used in a conversation also. I was talking with some ladies at church that homeSCHOOL and I put that emphasis there for obvious reasons. They usually make fun of me because they like to say that I do not ever teach my kids and they dont learn anything either. I think they are just jealous.
Anyhow, they were wondering how I respond to naysayers and rabid anti homeschoolers. I told them that other peoples opinions of me are none of my business. I thought it was brilliant. :-) (So thanks Tia...) They didnt get it! I think that they didnt get it because when we do hear others opinions of us we may tend to change what we are doing to conform to those said opinions. I think they would LIKE to unschool but feel that they could not because others may think that they are "doing nothing". I told them I dont want to change from what I am doing because it works for me and my kids. I am not sure whether they got it then or not but they understood I think.
Anyhow that was my AHHAH!!! moment for the weekend and I thought I would share!
God bless
Vivian
Mom to three Happy little Monkeys
Austin 10/31/93 Sarah 8/28/95 Emmalee 8/15/00
And loving wife to Randy

**If fifty million people say a foolish thing, it is still a foolish thing.
-Anatole France***




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tia's sig line

messages.messageBody:
>
>
><< What you think of me is none of my business. >>
>
>I actually quoted this to someone yesterday Tia!! It's great.

I really like it too. It's something I always try to remember and also try
to pass on to my kids. I swiped it from the title of a book. I never
finished the book, but I like the title. Someone else asked it they could
use it. I don't own it. <g>
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.messageBody:

What a great line! May I use it occasionally as well?

Jane

><< What you think of me is none of my business. >>

I may not have gone where I intended to go, but I think I have ended
up where I intended to be.
- Douglas Adams
